block.p: Elizabeth Carol Marlantes, a daughter of Carol and Lorian Marlantes of New York, was married yesterday to Nathan Scott Tyrrell, a son of Linda Tyrrell of Pasadena, Calif., and David Tyrrell of Tampa, Fla. The Rev. Robert M. Walker, a United Methodist minister, performed the ceremony at the First Church of Round Hill in Greenwich, Conn.

The bride, 26, is a staff editor in the national news department at The Christian Science Monitor in Boston. She graduated magna cum laude from Harvard and received a master's degree in English literature from Oxford University in England. Her father is the president and chief executive of the Rockefeller Group International, a commercial real estate company in New York.

Elizabeth Carol Marlantes, a daughter of Carol and Lorian Marlantes of New York, was married yesterday to Nathan Scott Tyrrell, a son of Linda Tyrrell of Pasadena, Calif., and David Tyrrell of Tampa, Fla. The Rev. Robert M. Walker, a United Methodist minister, performed the ceremony at the First Church of Round Hill in Greenwich, Conn.

The bride, 26, is a staff editor in the national news department at The Christian Science Monitor in Boston. She graduated magna cum laude from Harvard and received a master's degree in English literature from Oxford University in England. Her father is the president and chief executive of the Rockefeller Group International, a commercial real estate company in New York.

The bridegroom, 27, is a director of business development for myteam.com, a Web site based in Woburn, Mass., aimed at players, coaches and fans of amateur and youth sports. He received a bachelor's degree cum laude and an M.B.A. from Harvard. His father is a partner in Hill, Ward & Henderson, a Tampa law firm.
